    7: %% you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    8: %% You may obtain a copy of the License at
    9: %%

   11: %%

   13: %% distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
   14: %% WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
   15: %% See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
   16: %% limitations under the License.
   17: %%
   18: %% %CopyrightEnd%
   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_debug_info_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Make sure that we test running code compiled using the
   23: %% `beam_debug_info` option. This will ensure that we test
   24: %% `beam_disasm` on a module with debug information.
   25: -compile([beam_debug_info]).
   26: 
   27: -include("beam_opcodes.hrl").
   28: 
   29: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   30: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   33:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   34:          smoke/1,
   35:          fixed_bugs/1,
   36:          empty_module/1,
   37:          call_in_call_args/1,
   38:          missing_vars/1]).
   39: 
   40: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   41: 
   42: all() ->
   43:     [smoke,
   44:      {group,p}].
   45: 
   46: groups() ->
   47:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   48:       [fixed_bugs,
   49:        empty_module,
   50:        call_in_call_args,
   51:        missing_vars]}].
   52: 
   53: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   54:     id(Config),
   55:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   59:     ok.
   60: 
   61: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: smoke(_Config) ->
   68:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{}),
   69: 
   70:     TestBeams0 = get_unique_beam_files(),
   71:     TestBeams = compiler_beams() ++ TestBeams0,
   72: 
   73:     S = ~"""
   74:          Below, for each module, there is a list of functions with
   75:          variables missing in the BEAM debug info. Note that there
   76:          will probably never be possible to have all variables
   77:          present in the debug info, because some variables die before
   78:          a `debug_line` instruction is reached.
   79: 
   80:          ** means that at least one of the missing variables is
   81:             significant (does not start with an underscore).
   82: 
   83:          """,
   84:     io:put_chars(S),
   85: 
   86:     HasDbgSupport = erlang:system_info(emu_flavor) =:= jit,
   87: 
   88:     test_lib:p_run(fun(Beam) ->
   89:                            do_smoke(Beam, Node, HasDbgSupport)
   90:                    end, TestBeams),
   91: 
   92:     peer:stop(Peer),
   93: 
   94:     ok.
   95: 
   96: 
   97: compiler_beams() ->
   98:     filelib:wildcard(filename:join([code:lib_dir(compiler), "ebin", "*.beam"])).
   99: 
  100: do_smoke(Beam, Node, HasDbgSupport) ->
  101:     try
  102: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr0}}]}} =
  103: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  104: 
  105:         %% beam_validator will check for each `debug_line` instruction
  106:         %% that the frame size is correct and that all referenced BEAM
  107:         %% registers are valid.
  108:         {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:forms(Abstr0,
  109:                                       [beam_debug_info,binary,report_errors]),
  110:         {ok,_,Abstr} = compile:forms(Abstr0,
  111:                                      [beam_debug_info,dexp,binary,report_errors]),
  112:         SrcVars = source_variables(Abstr),
  113:         IndexToFunctionMap = abstr_debug_lines(Abstr),
  114: 
  115:         %% Retrieve the debug information in two different ways.
  116:         {DebugInfo,CookedDebugInfo} = get_debug_info(Mod, Code),
  117:         CookedDebugInfoSorted = lists:sort(CookedDebugInfo),
  118:         DebugInfoBif = case HasDbgSupport of
  119:                            true ->
  120:                                lists:sort(load_get_debug_info(Node, Mod, Code));
  121:                            false ->
  122:                                %% No runtime support for debug info.
  123:                                CookedDebugInfoSorted
  124:                        end,
  125:         if
  126:             CookedDebugInfoSorted =:= DebugInfoBif ->
  127:                 ok;
  128:             true ->
  129:                 Z0 = lists:zip(CookedDebugInfoSorted, DebugInfoBif,
  130:                                {pad, {short,short}}),
  131:                 Z = lists:dropwhile(fun({A,B}) -> A =:= B end, Z0),
  132:                 io:format("~p\n", [Z]),
  133:                 io:format("~p\n", [CookedDebugInfoSorted]),
  134:                 io:format("~p\n", [DebugInfoBif]),
  135: 
  136:                 error(inconsistent_debug_info)
  137:         end,
  138: 
  139:         case Mod of
  140:             ?MODULE when HasDbgSupport ->
  141:                 %% This module has been compiled with `beam_debug_info`.
  142:                 CookedDebugInfoSorted = lists:sort(code:get_debug_info(Mod));
  143:             _ ->
  144:                 ok
  145:         end,
  146: 
  147:         {DbgVars,DbgLiterals} = debug_info_vars(DebugInfo, IndexToFunctionMap),
  148: 
  149:         %% The debug information must only contain variables that are
  150:         %% present in the source code. If the sanity check below
  151:         %% fails, it could be for one of the following reasons:
  152:         %%
  153:         %%   * A compiler pass has introduced a new temporary variable
  154:         %%     whose name is a legal Erlang variable name. (Such
  155:         %%     temporary variables are supposed to have invalid names,
  156:         %%     such as `rec1`.)
  157:         %%
  158:         %%   * Something is wrong in the mapping from `debug_line`
  159:         %%     instruction to function names, causing a variable to be
  160:         %%     collected into the wrong function. (See
  161:         %%     abstr_debug_lines/1.)
  162:         %%
  163:         %%   * A heuristic in source_variables/1 is wrong, causing variables
  164:         %%     that actually are present in the debug information to be
  165:         %%     removed from the list of variables from the source code.
  166: 
  167:         [] = family_difference(DbgVars, SrcVars),
  168: 
  169:         %% Now figure out which variables are missing from the debug info
  170:         %% and print them.
  171:         AllDbg = family_union(DbgVars, DbgLiterals),
  172:         Diff0 = family_difference(SrcVars, AllDbg),
  173:         Diff = [begin
  174:                     {Vars,B} = format_vars(Vars0),
  175:                     S = io_lib:format("~p/~p: ~ts", [F,A,Vars]),
  176:                     ["  ",case B of
  177:                               true -> "   " ++ S;
  178:                               false -> "** " ++ S
  179:                           end,"\n"]
  180:                 end || {{F,A},Vars0} <:- Diff0],
  181:         io:format("~p:\n~ts", [Mod,Diff])
  182:     catch
  183: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
  184: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
  185: 		      [Error,Beam]),
  186: 	    error;
  187: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
  188: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
  189: 	    error
  190:     end.
  191: 
  192: format_vars(Vs) ->
  193:     Str = lists:join(", ", [io_lib:format("~ts", [V]) || V <- Vs]),
  194:     B = lists:all(fun(V) ->
  195:                           case atom_to_binary(V) of
  196:                               <<"_",_/binary>> -> true;
  197:                               _ -> false
  198:                           end
  199:                   end, Vs),
  200:     {Str,B}.
  201: 
  202: debug_info_vars(DebugInfo, IndexToFunctionMap) ->
  203:     {Vars0,Literals0} = debug_info_vars_1(DebugInfo, IndexToFunctionMap, [], []),
  204:     Vars = family_union(Vars0),
  205:     Literals = family_union(Literals0),
  206:     {Vars,Literals}.
  207: 
  208: debug_info_vars_1([{I,{_FrameSize,List}}|T], IndexToFunctionMap, VarAcc, LitAcc) ->
  209:     case debug_info_vars_2(List, [], []) of
  210:         {[],[]} ->
  211:             debug_info_vars_1(T, IndexToFunctionMap, VarAcc, LitAcc);
  212:         {Vars,Literals} ->
  213:             F = map_get(I, IndexToFunctionMap),
  214:             debug_info_vars_1(T, IndexToFunctionMap,
  215:                               [{F,Vars}|VarAcc], [{F,Literals}|LitAcc])
  216:     end;
  217: debug_info_vars_1([], _, VarAcc, LitAcc) ->
  218:     {VarAcc,LitAcc}.
  219: 
  220: debug_info_vars_2([{Name,_Value}|T], VarAcc, LitAcc) when is_integer(Name) ->
  221:     debug_info_vars_2(T, VarAcc, LitAcc);
  222: debug_info_vars_2([{Name0,Value}|T], VarAcc, LitAcc) when is_binary(Name0) ->
  223:     Name = binary_to_atom(Name0),
  224:     case Value of
  225:         {x,_} -> debug_info_vars_2(T, [Name|VarAcc], LitAcc);
  226:         {y,_} -> debug_info_vars_2(T, [Name|VarAcc], LitAcc);
  227:         {value,_} -> debug_info_vars_2(T, VarAcc, [Name|LitAcc])
  228:     end;
  229: debug_info_vars_2([], VarAcc, LitAcc) ->
  230:     {VarAcc,LitAcc}.
  231: 
  232: family_union(S0) ->
  233:     S1 = sofs:relation(S0, [{function,[variable]}]),
  234:     S2 = sofs:relation_to_family(S1),
  235:     S3 = sofs:family_union(S2),
  236:     sofs:to_external(S3).
  237: 
  238: family_union(F0, F1) ->
  239:     S0 = sofs:relation(F0, [{function,[variable]}]),
  240:     S1 = sofs:relation(F1, [{function,[variable]}]),
  241:     S2 = sofs:family_union(S0, S1),
  242:     sofs:to_external(S2).
  243: 
  244: family_difference(F0, F1) ->
  245:     S0 = sofs:family(F0, [{function,[variable]}]),
  246:     S1 = sofs:family(F1, [{function,[variable]}]),
  247:     S2 = sofs:family_difference(S0, S1),
  248:     SpecFun = fun(S) -> sofs:no_elements(S) =/= 0 end,
  249:     S3 = sofs:family_specification(SpecFun, S2),
  250:     sofs:to_external(S3).
  251: 
  252: %% Load a module on a remote node and retrieve debug information.
  253: load_get_debug_info(Node, Mod, Beam) ->
  254:     erpc:call(Node,
  255:               fun() ->
  256:                       {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Beam),
  257:                       DebugInfo = code:get_debug_info(Mod),
  258: 
  259:                       case Mod of
  260:                           ?MODULE ->
  261:                               %% Don't purge the module that this fun
  262:                               %% is located in.
  263:                               ok;
  264:                           _ ->
  265:                               %% Smoke test of purging a module with
  266:                               %% debug information.
  267:                               _ = code:delete(Mod),
  268:                               _ = code:purge(Mod)
  269:                       end,
  270:                       DebugInfo
  271:               end).
  272: 
  273: %%
  274: %% Extract variables mentioned in the source code. Try to remove
  275: %% variables that will never show up in the debug information; for
  276: %% examples, definitions of variables that are not followed by any
  277: %% `debug_line` instructions can be ignored.
  278: %%
  279: source_variables(Abstr) ->
  280:     [{{Name,Arity},extract_src_vars(F)} ||
  281:         {function,_,Name,Arity,_}=F <- Abstr].
  282: 
  283: extract_src_vars(F) ->
  284:     L1 = extract_src_vars(F, true, #{}),
  285:     L2 = [V || V := true <- L1],
  286:     lists:sort(L2).
  287: 
  288: extract_src_vars({var,_,'_'}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  289:     Acc;
  290: extract_src_vars({var,_,Name}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  291:     case atom_to_binary(Name) of
  292:         <<"cov",_/binary>> ->
  293:             %% Ignore variable added by the sys_coverage pass.
  294:             Acc0;
  295:         <<"rec",_/binary>> ->
  296:             %% Ignore variable added by the erl_expand_pass.
  297:             Acc0;
  298:         _ ->
  299:             true = beam_ssa_codegen:is_original_variable(Name),
  300:             Acc0#{Name => true}
  301:     end;
  302: extract_src_vars({atom,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  303: extract_src_vars({bin,_,Es}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  304:     extract_args(Es, Acc);
  305: extract_src_vars({bin_element,_,Val,Size,_}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  306:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Val, false, Acc0),
  307:     case Size of
  308:         default -> Acc1;
  309:         _ -> extract_src_vars(Size, false, Acc1)
  310:     end;
  311: extract_src_vars({char,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  312: extract_src_vars({float,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  313: extract_src_vars({integer,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  314: extract_src_vars({nil,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  315: extract_src_vars({string,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  316: extract_src_vars({cons,_,Hd,Tl}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  317:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Hd, Lc, Acc0),
  318:     extract_src_vars(Tl, Lc, Acc1);
  319: extract_src_vars({map,_,Fs}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  320:     extract_args(Fs, Acc0);
  321: extract_src_vars({map,_,M,Fs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  322:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(M, Lc, Acc0),
  323:     extract_args(Fs, Acc1);
  324: extract_src_vars({map_field_assoc,_,K,V}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  325:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(K, false, Acc0),
  326:     extract_src_vars(V, false, Acc1);
  327: extract_src_vars({map_field_exact,_,K,V}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  328:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(K, false, Acc0),
  329:     extract_src_vars(V, false, Acc1);
  330: extract_src_vars({tuple,_,Es}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  331:     extract_args(Es, Acc);
  332: extract_src_vars({call,_,F,As}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  333:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(F, Lc, Acc0),
  334:     extract_args(As, Acc1);
  335: extract_src_vars({remote,_,Mod,Name}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  336:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Mod, Lc, Acc0),
  337:     extract_src_vars(Name, Lc, Acc1);
  338: extract_src_vars({match,_,P,E}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  339:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(P, false, Acc0),
  340:     extract_src_vars(E, Lc, Acc1);
  341: extract_src_vars({op,_,_Name,Arg}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  342:     extract_src_vars(Arg, Lc, Acc0);
  343: extract_src_vars({op,_,_Name,Lhs,Rhs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  344:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Lhs, false, Acc0),
  345:     extract_src_vars(Rhs, Lc, Acc1);
  346: extract_src_vars({debug_line,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  347:     Acc;
  348: extract_src_vars({executable_line,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  349:     Acc;
  350: extract_src_vars({named_fun,_,Name,Cs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  351:     case any_debug_line_instrs(Cs) of
  352:         false ->
  353:             %% Since there are no `debug_line` instructions within this fun,
  354:             %% none of the variables defined in the fun should ever
  355:             %% show up in the debug info.
  356:             Acc0;
  357:         true when Name =/= '_' ->
  358:             Acc = case Name of
  359:                       '_' -> Acc0;
  360:                       _ -> extract_src_vars({var,anno,Name}, Lc, Acc0)
  361:                   end,
  362:             extract_cs(Cs, true, Acc)
  363:     end;
  364: extract_src_vars({function,_Anno,_,_,Cs}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  365:     case any_debug_line_instrs(Cs) of
  366:         true ->
  367:             extract_cs(Cs, true, Acc0);
  368:         false ->
  369:             %% There are no `debug_line` instructions in this
  370:             %% function. This happens if code has been placed in a
  371:             %% header filer, or if the `-file()` attribute has been
  372:             %% used to change the name of the source file.
  373:             Acc0
  374:     end;
  375: extract_src_vars({'fun',_Anno,{clauses,Cs}}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  376:     case any_debug_line_instrs(Cs) of
  377:         true ->
  378:             extract_cs(Cs, true, Acc0);
  379:         false ->
  380:             Acc0
  381:     end;
  382: extract_src_vars({'fun',_Anno,_}, _Lc, Acc0) -> Acc0;
  383: extract_src_vars({block,_Anno,Es}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  384:     extract_body(Es, Lc, Acc0);
  385: extract_src_vars({'receive',_Anno,Cs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  386:     extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc0);
  387: extract_src_vars({'receive',_Anno,Cs,_To,ToE}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  388:     Acc1 = extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc0),
  389:     extract_body(ToE, Lc, Acc1);
  390: extract_src_vars({'maybe',_Anno,Body}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  391:     extract_body(Body, Lc, Acc0);
  392: extract_src_vars({'maybe',_Anno,Body,{'else',_,ElseClauses}}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  393:     Acc1 = extract_body(Body, Lc, Acc0),
  394:     extract_cs(ElseClauses, Lc, Acc1);
  395: extract_src_vars({'maybe_match',_Anno,P,E}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  396:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(P, false, Acc0),
  397:     extract_src_vars(E, Lc, Acc1);
  398: extract_src_vars({'case',_Anno,E,Cs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  399:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(E, false, Acc0),
  400:     extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc1);
  401: extract_src_vars({'if',_Anno,Cs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  402:     extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc0);
  403: extract_src_vars({'try',_Anno,Es,Scs,Ccs,As}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  404:     Acc1 = extract_body(Es, false, Acc0),
  405:     Acc2 = extract_cs(Scs, Lc, Acc1),
  406:     Acc3 = extract_cs(Ccs, Lc, Acc2),
  407:     extract_body(As, Lc, Acc3);
  408: extract_src_vars({'catch',_Anno,E}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  409:     extract_src_vars(E, Lc, Acc0);
  410: extract_src_vars({zip,_,Qs0}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  411:     Qs = extract_sv_qs(Qs0),
  412:     extract_args(Qs, Acc0);
  413: extract_src_vars({C,_,Build,Qs0}, Lc, Acc0)
  414:   when C =:= lc; C =:= bc; C =:= mc ->
  415:     case any_debug_line_instrs(Build) of
  416:         false ->
  417:             Qs = extract_sv_qs(Qs0),
  418:             case any_debug_line_instrs(Qs) of
  419:                 false ->
  420:                     Acc0;
  421:                 true ->
  422:                     extract_args(Qs, Acc0)
  423:             end;
  424:         true ->
  425:             Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Build, Lc, Acc0),
  426:             extract_args(Qs0, Acc1)
  427:     end;
  428: extract_src_vars({G,_,P,E}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  429:     true = is_generator(G),                     %Assertion.
  430:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(P, false, Acc0),
  431:     extract_src_vars(E, false, Acc1).
  432: 
  433: is_generator(generate) -> true;
  434: is_generator(b_generate) -> true;
  435: is_generator(m_generate) -> true;
  436: is_generator(generate_strict) -> true;
  437: is_generator(b_generate_strict) -> true;
  438: is_generator(m_generate_strict) -> true;
  439: is_generator(_) -> false.
  440: 
  441: extract_cs([{clause,_,Pats,Gs,Body}|Cs], Lc, Acc0) ->
  442:     case Lc andalso not any_debug_line_instrs(Body)  of
  443:         true ->
  444:             extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc0);
  445:         false ->
  446:             Acc1 = extract_args(Pats, Acc0),
  447:             Acc2 = extract_guards(Gs, Acc1),
  448:             Acc3 = extract_body(Body, Lc, Acc2),
  449:             extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc3)
  450:     end;
  451: extract_cs([], _, Acc) ->
  452:     Acc.
  453: 
  454: extract_body([I], Lc, Acc) ->
  455:     case Lc andalso not any_debug_line_instrs(I) of
  456:         true ->
  457:             Acc;
  458:         false ->
  459:             extract_src_vars(I, Lc, Acc)
  460:     end;
  461: extract_body([I|Is], Lc, Acc0) ->
  462:     Acc = extract_src_vars(I, false, Acc0),
  463:     extract_body(Is, Lc, Acc);
  464: extract_body([], _Lc, Acc) -> Acc.
  465: 
  466: extract_args([A|As], Acc) ->
  467:     extract_args(As, extract_src_vars(A, false, Acc));
  468: extract_args([], Acc) -> Acc.
  469: 
  470: extract_guards([A|As], Acc) ->
  471:     extract_guards(As, extract_args(A, Acc));
  472: extract_guards([], Acc) -> Acc.
  473: 
  474: extract_sv_qs([{block,BlkL,[{executable_line,_,_}|Bs]}|Qs1]) ->
  475:     %% Note: `debug_line` instructions are `executable_line`
  476:     %% instructions in the abstract code.
  477:     [{block,BlkL,Bs}|extract_sv_qs_1(Qs1)];
  478: extract_sv_qs(Qs) -> Qs.
  479: 
  480: extract_sv_qs_1([Q|Qs]) ->
  481:     case abstr_extract_debug_lines(Qs, []) of
  482:         [] ->
  483:             [Q];
  484:         [_|_] ->
  485:             [Q|extract_sv_qs_1(Qs)]
  486:     end;
  487: extract_sv_qs_1([]) -> [].
  488: 
  489: any_debug_line_instrs(Abstr) ->
  490:     abstr_extract_debug_lines(Abstr, []) =/= [].
  491: 
  492: %%
  493: %% Return a mapping from `debug_line` instruction index to function.
  494: %%
  495: abstr_debug_lines(Abstr) ->
  496:     S0 = [{{Name,Arity},abstr_extract_debug_lines(Body)} ||
  497:              {function,_,Name,Arity,Body} <- Abstr],
  498:     S1 = sofs:family(S0, [{function,[line]}]),
  499:     S2 = sofs:family_to_relation(S1),
  500:     S3 = sofs:converse(S2),
  501:     S4 = sofs:to_external(S3),
  502:     maps:from_list(S4).
  503: 
  504: abstr_extract_debug_lines(Abstr) ->
  505:     abstr_extract_debug_lines(Abstr, []).
  506: 
  507: abstr_extract_debug_lines({debug_line,_,Index}, Acc) ->
  508:     [Index|Acc];
  509: abstr_extract_debug_lines([H|T], Acc0) ->
  510:     Acc1 = abstr_extract_debug_lines(H, Acc0),
  511:     abstr_extract_debug_lines(T, Acc1);
  512: abstr_extract_debug_lines(Tuple, Acc0) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  513:     abstr_extract_debug_lines(tuple_to_list(Tuple), Acc0);
  514: abstr_extract_debug_lines(_, Acc) -> Acc.
  515: 
  516: %%%
  517: %%% Read and disassemble the BEAM debug information from the "DbgB"
  518: %%% chunk of a BEAM file.
  519: %%%
  520: get_debug_info(Mod, Beam) ->
  521:     {ok,{Mod,[{"DbgB",DebugInfo0},
  522:               {atoms,Atoms0},
  523:               {"Line",Lines0}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["DbgB",atoms,"Line"]),
  524:     Atoms = maps:from_list(Atoms0),
  525:     Literals = case beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["LitT"]) of
  526:                    {ok,{Mod,[{"LitT",Literals0}]}} ->
  527:                        decode_literal_table(Literals0);
  528:                    {error,_,_} ->
  529:                        []
  530:                end,
  531:     Op = beam_opcodes:opcode(call, 2),
  532:     <<Version:32,
  533:       _NumItems:32,
  534:       _NumVars:32,
  535:       DebugInfo1/binary>> = DebugInfo0,
  536:     0 = Version,
  537:     RawDebugInfo0 = decode_debug_info(DebugInfo1, Literals, Atoms, Op),
  538:     RawDebugInfo = lists:zip(lists:seq(1, length(RawDebugInfo0)), RawDebugInfo0),
  539: 
  540:     %% The cooked debug info has line numbers instead of indices.
  541:     Lines = decode_line_table(Lines0, Literals, Atoms),
  542:     {beam_file,Mod,_Exp,_Attr,_Opts,Fs} = beam_disasm:file(Beam),
  543:     DebugMap = #{Index => LocationIndex ||
  544:                    {function,_Name,_Arity,_Entry,Is} <:- Fs,
  545:                    {debug_line,LocationIndex,Index,_Live} <- Is},
  546:     CookedDebugInfo =
  547:         [{map_get(map_get(Index, DebugMap), Lines),Info} ||
  548:             {Index,Info} <:- RawDebugInfo,
  549:             is_map_key(Index, DebugMap)],
  550: 
  551:     {RawDebugInfo,CookedDebugInfo}.
  552: 
  553: decode_line_table(<<0:32,_Bits:32,_NumIs:32,NumLines:32,
  554:                     _NumFnames:32, Lines0/binary>>,
  555:                   Literals, Atoms) ->
  556:     Lines = decode_line_tab_1(Lines0, Literals, Atoms, NumLines),
  557:     #{K => V || {K,V} <:- lists:zip(lists:seq(1, length(Lines)), Lines)}.
  558: 
  559: decode_line_tab_1(_Lines, _Literals, _Atoms, 0) ->
  560:     [];
  561: decode_line_tab_1(Lines0, Literals, Atoms, N) ->
  562:     case decode_arg(Lines0, Literals, Atoms) of
  563:         {{atom,_},Lines1} ->
  564:             decode_line_tab_1(Lines1, Literals, Atoms, N);
  565:         {{integer,Line},Lines1} ->
  566:             [Line|decode_line_tab_1(Lines1, Literals, Atoms, N - 1)];
  567:         {nil,Lines1} ->
  568:             decode_line_tab_1(Lines1, Literals, Atoms, N)
  569:     end.
  570: 
  571: decode_literal_table(<<0:32,N:32,Tab/binary>>) ->
  572:     #{Index => binary_to_term(Literal) ||
  573:         Index <- lists:seq(0, N - 1) &&
  574:             <<Size:32,Literal:Size/binary>> <:= Tab}.
  575: 
  576: decode_debug_info(Code0, Literals, Atoms, Op) ->
  577:     case Code0 of
  578:         <<Op,Code1/binary>> ->
  579:             {FrameSize0,Code2} = decode_arg(Code1, Literals, Atoms),
  580:             FrameSize = case FrameSize0 of
  581:                             nil -> none;
  582:                             {atom,entry} -> entry;
  583:                             _ -> FrameSize0
  584:                         end,
  585:             {{list,List0},Code3} = decode_arg(Code2, Literals, Atoms),
  586:             List = decode_list(List0),
  587:             [{FrameSize,List}|decode_debug_info(Code3, Literals, Atoms, Op)];
  588:         <<>> ->
  589:             []
  590:     end.
  591: 
  592: decode_list([{integer,Var}|T]) when is_integer(Var) ->
  593:     decode_list([{literal,Var}|T]);
  594: decode_list([{literal,Var},Where0|T]) ->
  595:     Where = case Where0 of
  596:                 {literal,Lit} -> {value,Lit};
  597:                 {atom,A} -> {value,A};
  598:                 {integer,I} -> {value,I};
  599:                 nil -> {value,[]};
  600:                 {x,_} -> Where0;
  601:                 {y,_} -> Where0
  602:             end,
  603:     [{Var,Where}|decode_list(T)];
  604: decode_list([]) -> [].
  605: 
  606: decode_args(0, Code, _Literals, _Atoms) ->
  607:     {[],Code};
  608: decode_args(N, Code0, Literals, Atoms) when is_integer(N), N > 0 ->
  609:     {Arg,Code1} = decode_arg(Code0, Literals, Atoms),
  610:     {Args,Code2} = decode_args(N - 1, Code1, Literals, Atoms),
  611:     {[Arg|Args],Code2}.
  612: 
  613: decode_arg(Code0, Literals, Atoms) ->
  614:     case decode_raw_arg(Code0) of
  615:         {nil,_}=Res -> Res;
  616:         {{u,N},Code1} ->
  617:             {N,Code1};
  618:         {{atom,Index},Code1} ->
  619:             {{atom,map_get(Index, Atoms)},Code1};
  620:         {{integer,_},_}=Res -> Res;
  621:         {{x,_},_}=Res -> Res;
  622:         {{y,_},_}=Res -> Res;
  623:         {{z,1},Code1} ->
  624:             {{u,N},Code2} = decode_raw_arg(Code1),
  625:             {List,Code3} = decode_args(N, Code2, Literals, Atoms),
  626:             {{list,List},Code3};
  627:         {{z,4},Code1} ->
  628:             {{u,N},Code2} = decode_raw_arg(Code1),
  629:             {{literal,map_get(N, Literals)},Code2}
  630:     end.
  631: 
  632: decode_raw_arg(<<0:4,0:1,?tag_a:3,Code/binary>>) ->
  633:     {nil,Code};
  634: decode_raw_arg(<<N:4,0:1,Tag:3,Code/binary>>) ->
  635:     {{decode_tag(Tag),N},Code};
  636: decode_raw_arg(<<2#111:3,1:1,1:1,Tag:3,Code0/binary>>) ->
  637:     {{u,W0},Code1} = decode_raw_arg(Code0),
  638:     W = W0 + 9,
  639:     <<N:W/signed-unit:8,Code2/binary>> = Code1,
  640:     {{decode_tag(Tag),N},Code2};
  641: decode_raw_arg(<<W0:3,1:1,1:1,Tag:3,Code0/binary>>) ->
  642:     W = W0 + 2,
  643:     <<N:W/signed-unit:8,Code1/binary>> = Code0,
  644:     {{decode_tag(Tag),N},Code1};
  645: decode_raw_arg(<<High:3,0:1,1:1,Tag:3,Low,Code0/binary>>) ->
  646:     N = (High bsl 8) bor Low,
  647:     {{decode_tag(Tag),N},Code0}.
  648: 
  649: decode_tag(?tag_u) -> u;
  650: decode_tag(?tag_i) -> integer;
  651: decode_tag(?tag_a) -> atom;
  652: decode_tag(?tag_x) -> x;
  653: decode_tag(?tag_y) -> y;
  654: decode_tag(?tag_z) -> z.
  655: 
  656: %%%
  657: %%% Other test cases.
  658: %%%
  659: 
  660: fixed_bugs(_Config) ->
  661:     ok = unassigned_yreg(ok),
  662:     {'EXIT',_} = catch unassigned_yreg(not_ok),
  663: 
  664:     ~"xyz" = wrong_frame_size(id(~"xyz")),
  665:     boom = catch wrong_frame_size(id(42)),
  666: 
  667:     {ok,error} = no_function(ok),
  668: 
  669:     ok.
  670: 
  671: unassigned_yreg(V) ->
  672:     case id(V) of
  673:         _ ->
  674:             case V of ok -> ok end,
  675:             case catch id(whatever) of
  676:                 Y ->
  677:                     case id(true) of
  678:                         true ->
  679:                             id(Y),
  680:                             ok;
  681:                         false ->
  682:                             ok
  683:                     end
  684:             end
  685:     end.
  686: 
  687: wrong_frame_size(X) ->
  688:     id(X),
  689:     case id(X) of
  690:         Y when is_binary(Y) -> Y;
  691:         _Err -> throw(boom)
  692:     end.
  693: 
  694: no_function(X) ->
  695:     case catch id(X) of
  696:         ok ->
  697:             case catch id(error) of
  698:                 Err ->
  699:                     id(0),
  700:                     id({X, Err})
  701:             end;
  702:         Err ->
  703:             id(0),
  704:             id({X, Err})
  705:     end.
  706: 
  707: 
  708: empty_module(_Config) ->
  709:     Mod = list_to_atom(?MODULE_STRING ++ "_" ++
  710:                            atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
  711:     Empty = [{attribute,{1,1},file,{atom_to_list(Mod),1}},
  712:              {attribute,{1,2},module,Mod},
  713:              {eof,{3,1}}],
  714:     {ok,Mod,_Code} = compile:forms(Empty, [beam_debug_info,report]),
  715: 
  716:     ok.
  717: 
  718: call_in_call_args(Config) ->
  719:     M = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  720:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  721:     SrcName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(M) ++ ".erl"),
  722: 
  723:     S = ~"""
  724:          -module(call_in_call_args).
  725:          -export([f/1]).
  726: 
  727:          f(X) ->
  728:              bar:g(
  729:                bar:h(X),
  730:                id(X)
  731:               ).
  732:          id(I) -> I.
  733:          """,
  734: 
  735:     ok = file:write_file(SrcName, S),
  736:     {ok,M,Asm} = compile:file(SrcName, [report,beam_debug_info,binary,to_asm]),
  737:     {M,_,_,[{function,f,1,_,Is}|_],_} = Asm,
  738:     DebugLines = [I || I <- Is, element(1, I) =:= debug_line],
  739:     io:format("~p\n", [DebugLines]),
  740:     4 = length(DebugLines),
  741: 
  742:     ok.
  743: 
  744: missing_vars(Config) ->
  745:     M = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  746:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  747:     SrcName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(M) ++ ".erl"),
  748: 
  749:     S = ~"""
  750:          -module(missing_vars).              %%L01
  751:          -export([f/3]).                     %%L02
  752:          f(X, Y, Z0) ->                      %%L03
  753:              case X of                       %%L04
  754:                  false ->                    %%L05
  755:                      Z1 = Z0#{k := Y},       %%L06
  756:                      foo:go(X),              %%L07
  757:                      Z1;                     %%L08
  758:                  _ ->                        %%L09
  759:                      Z1 = Z0#{k := X},       %%L10
  760:                      Z1                      %%L11
  761:              end.                            %%L12
  762:          """,
  763: 
  764:     ok = file:write_file(SrcName, S),
  765:     {ok,M,Asm} = compile:file(SrcName, [report,beam_debug_info,binary,to_asm]),
  766:     {M,_,_,[{function,f,3,_,Is}|_],_} = Asm,
  767:     DebugLines0 = [begin
  768:                        {location,_File,Line} = lists:keyfind(location, 1, Anno),
  769:                        {Line,FrameSz,[Name || {Name,_} <- Vars]}
  770:                    end || {debug_line,Anno,_,_,{FrameSz,Vars}} <- Is],
  771:     DebugLines = lists:sort(DebugLines0),
  772:     io:format("~p\n", [DebugLines]),
  773:     Expected = [{3,entry,[{integer,1},{integer,2},{integer,3}]},
  774:                 {4,none,['X','Y','Z0']},
  775:                 {6,none,['X','Y','Z0']},
  776:                 {7,none,['X','Z0','Z1']},
  777:                 {8,1,['Z1']},
  778:                 {10,none,['X','Y','Z0']},
  779:                 {11,none,['Y','Z0','Z1']}],
  780: 
  781:     ?assertEqual(Expected, DebugLines),
  782: 
  783:     ok.
  784: 
  785: 
  786: %%%
  787: %%% Common utility functions.
  788: %%%
  789: 
  790: get_unique_beam_files() ->
  791:     F = fun IsCloned(ModString) ->
  792:                 case ModString of
  793:                     "_dialyzer_SUITE" -> true;
  794:                     "_r25_SUITE" -> true;
  795:                     [_|T] -> IsCloned(T);
  796:                     _ -> false
  797:                 end
  798:         end,
  799:     test_lib:get_unique_files(".beam", F).
  800: 
  801: id(I) -> I.
